statement: RGB stands for what?
explanation: RGB (Red, Green, and Blue) refers to a system for representing the colors to be used on computer displays.

statement: What is an algorithm?
explanation: An algorithm is a set of instructions to solve a problem.

statement: C language was developed at
explanation: C language was developed by Dennis Ritchie at Bell Labs.

statement: Wi-Fi stands for
options: It's a name, not an abbreviation
explanation: Wi-Fi or WiFi is a technology for wireless local area networking.

statement: RAM acts as a
explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is a volatile (temporary) memory.

statement: Bugs, in a computer program, are what?
explanation: A bug is an error, flaw, failure or fault in a computer program or system that causes it to produce an incorrect or unexpected result.

statement: PHP stands for
explanation: Consider it a joke! It originally stood for Personal Home Page. Now it has a recursive acronym PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor.

statement: 0s and 1s in a computer system are stored in
explanation: The 0s and 1s in a computer system are represented by the ON (1) and OFF (0) states of the transistors.

statement: Scratch, a graphical programming language for beginners, was built at
explanation: Scratch is a project of the Lifelong Kindergarten Group at the MIT Media Lab.

statement: A server is a computer system which does what?
options: Runs services such as HTTP and SMTP
explanation: A server is a computer program or a device that provides functionality/services for other programs or devices, called clients. Most common servers are webservers, running HTTP service.

statement: IoT stands for
explanation: IoT is made up of things such as microwaves, refrigerators and cars, all connected to the internet.

statement: Segmentation fault is which type of error?
explanation: Segmentation fault is a memory error which occurs at runtime.

statement: A Hard Disk has 12 tracks in total. If each track has 5 sectors and each sector can hold 512 kB, then what is the total capacity of the Hard Disk?
explanation: Total capacity = total tracks × sectors per track × bit density of a track

statement: LCD stands for
explanation: A Liquid-Crystal Display uses the light-modulating properties of liquid crystals.

statement: A boolean is a data type with how many possible values?
explanation: A boolean can have only two possible values, true (ON) or false (OFF).

statement: Which one of these memory types is faster?
explanation: Fixed Word-length memory is faster because the computer knows where a new record starts.

statement: Torrents use which network architecture?
explanation: Downloaders of torrents also contribute to upload bandwidth, keeping the torrent fast.

statement: Which of the following is a lossy image format?
explanation: RAW, BMP and PNG are all lossless image formats.

statement: SVG stands for?
explanation: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation.

statement: Which one of these is not a programming language?
explanation: Although Python is also not a programming language (it's a scripting language), HTML is definitely not a programming language.

statement: Which of the following languages is faster at execution?
explanation: C language doesn't have many features such as Garbage Collection. Moreover, its executables are in native machine code.

statement: Sorting algorithm rarely used in practical applications is
explanation: The circumstances under which it can perform well are limited. It is mostly used for learning sorting algorithms.

statement: With reference to Electronics/Computers, CMOS stands for
explanation: CMOS is the small amount of memory on a computer motherboard that stores the BIOS settings.

statement: Pointers in C/C++ are variables which
options: hold the contents of another variable
hold the address of another variable
explanation: Pointers in C/C++ hold the address of another variable (point to the location of another variable in memory).

statement: Linux is an open source
explanation: Linux is an open source, Unix-based kernel developed by Linus Trovalds.

statement: Implementation of hardware components such as amplifiers, mixers, modulators/demodulators by means of software is called
explanation: Software-defined radio (SDR) is a radio communication system where components that have been typically implemented in hardware (e.g. mixers, amplifiers, modulators/demodulators, etc.) are instead implemented by means of software on a PC or embedded system.

statement: Cryptographic hash functions take in data of any size and
explanation: A hash function is any function that can be used to map data of arbitrary size to data of fixed size.

statement: In cloud computing, containers create an isolation boundary at what level?
explanation: If anything goes wrong in a single container (e.g., excessive consumption of resources by a process) it only affects that individual container and not the whole VM or whole server.

statement: Most commonly used public key encryption algorithm is
explanation: RSA is made of the initial letters of the surnames of Ron Rivest, Adi Shamir, and Leonard Adleman. It's an asymmetric encryption algorithm.

statement: Machine learning is related to which one of the following?
explanation: Machine learning can be used for data mining. However, for data mining other techniques can be used besides or on top of machine learning.

statement: Which of the following is a form of DoS (Denial of Service) attack?
explanation: A ping of death is a type of attack on a computer system that involves sending a malformed or otherwise malicious ping to a computer.

statement: Which one of the following is an example of IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service)?
explanation: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), are cloud infrastructure self-service models for accessing, monitoring, and managing remote datacenter infrastructures, such as compute, storage, networking, and networking services (e.g. firewalls).

statement: TLS (Transport Layer Security) is the successor of SSL (Secure Sockets Layer). SSL had which one of the following flaws?
explanation: Heartbleed was a vulnerability in the implementation of OpenSSL. POODLE affected the whole standard of SSL version 3.

statement: A data structure in which items are added at one end and removed from other end, is called
explanation: A Queue is a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) data structure. In a FIFO data structure, the first element added to the queue will be the first one to be removed.

statement: Bitcoin transactions are verified by
explanation: Miners keep the blockchain consistent, complete, and unalterable by repeatedly verifying and collecting newly broadcast transactions into a new group of transactions called a block.

statement: A method of encrypting alphabetic text by using a series of interwoven Caesar ciphers based on the letters of a keyword is
explanation: Vigenère cipher is a form of polyalphabetic substitution.

statement: A binary search algorithm, in worst case scenario, is asymptotically
explanation: In Binary search algorithm, a set of data is repeatedly divided into half and the middle element is processed. Which is the case of O(logn).

statement: Which one of the following is a non-linear data structure?
explanation: In a non-linear data structure, items are connected with each other.

statement: OSPF (Open Shortest Path First) is an example of
explanation: Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) is a routing protocol for Internet Protocol (IP) networks. It uses a link state routing (LSR) algorithm and falls into the group of interior gateway protocols (IGPs).

statement: A binary search tree whose right-subtree and left-subtree differ in height by at most one, is called
explanation: In an AVL tree, the heights of the two child subtrees of any node differ by at most one; if at any time they differ by more than one, rebalancing is done to restore this property.
